To simplify the radical expression $$\sqrt{147}$$, we need to find the prime factors of 147 and look for any pairs of the same factor.

147 can be factored as 3 × 49. Since 49 is a perfect square (7 × 7), we can simplify the expression as follows:

$$\sqrt{147} = \sqrt{3 × 49} = \sqrt{3 × 7 × 7}$$

Now, we can take the square root of the perfect square (49) and move it outside the radical:

$$\sqrt{3 × 7 × 7} = 7\sqrt{3}$$

So, the simplified radical expression is:

$$\sqrt{147} = 7\sqrt{3}$$
